safari.notes: Only supported through the allow attribute on <iframe> elements.

safari_ios.notes: Only supported through the allow attribute on <iframe> elements.

firefox.notes: Before Firefox 80, applying fullscreen to an <iframe> (i.e. via the allow attribute) does not work unless the allowfullscreen attribute is also present.

chrome.notes: WebVR API was never enabled by default in any production builds and was replaced by WebXR Device API.

chrome_android.notes: WebVR API was never enabled by default in any production builds and was replaced by WebXR Device API.

edge.notes: WebVR API was never enabled by default in any production builds and was replaced by WebXR Device API.

opera.notes: WebVR API was never enabled by default in any production builds and was replaced by WebXR Device API.

opera_android.notes: WebVR API was never enabled by default in any production builds and was replaced by WebXR Device API.

samsunginternet_android.notes: WebVR API was never enabled by default in any production builds and was replaced by WebXR Device API.
